div.p: TrackerDash was created as a University Final Year Project inspired by problems faced day-to-day working in industry.

There are many data analytics dashboards out there that had their own niches and selling points but there were common drawbacks to each of them, such as:
No option to host locally.
API limits.
Targetted towards non API users.
Not being able to retrieve historic graph data.
Not being able to save graphs or retrieve graph data.
$$$

With TrackerDash, the aim was to create an API driven data analytics server that can be hosted locally, so you can store and display sensitive information, that is lightweight and horizonally scalable.
Feedback will be greatly received and feel free to fork this project and expand on it's functionality.

TrackerDash makes extensive use of Highcharts JS which is licensed under creative commons. While under creative commons you are free to use TrackerDash and HighCharts software for non-commercial purposes, running this software might conflict with their Licensing terms, which can be found here.
